headline.main: Eloquent Tribute to the Late N. B. Blunt, Esq.; The following touching and eloquent tribute to the memory of the late N. B. BLUNT we find in the New-York correspondence of the New-Orleans Bulletin;--it is doubtless from the pen of his accomplished professional associate, A. OAKEY HALL, Esq.:

docs.lead_paragraph: The community is really in great affliction. We have lost by death one to whom the trite quotation, " He was a man, take him for all in all, we shall not look upon his like again," applies in eloquensforce. NATHANIEL BOWDITCH BLUNT, late District Attorney for the City and County of New York, has been suddenly stricken down in the midst of usefulness and honors!
docs.snippet: The community is really in great affliction. We have lost by death one to whom the trite quotation, " He was a man, take him for all in all, we shall not look upon his like again," applies in eloquensforce. NATHANIEL BOWDITCH BLUNT, late District...

docs.lead_paragraph: SINGULAR AFFAIR.-- A few days since a gentleman and lady stopped at Ballou's Hotel, in this village, for a leisurely ??ojairn. He represented himself from Lower Sandusky, Ohio, and said he was journeying for his wife's health. On the second evening after arrival, the lady come from her room to the office, and gave the clerk a small package, which she said contained poison. and wished him to take care of it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Never did a locomotive seem to me so much a traveling Vesuvius in full eruption, and a train of cars so like an itlaerant Pompeii, in its "last days," as on my journey to this place. But for swift motion, we would have been buried in cinders, smoke and dust.

headline.main: A Visit to Sir Wm. Hamilton.; From the Courier and Enquirer.

docs.lead_paragraph: The name of Sir WM. HAMILTON is not unknown to many in America, but of few men who have distinguished themselves in the world of letters is there so little personally known. The great master of critique, as Mr. COUSIN once called him in conversation with us, has lived a quiet life, whose even ten or has not been broken by any adventures that altract the attention and charm the imagination of the crowd.

docs.lead_paragraph: MORTALITY IN BROOKLYN.--Dr. WENDELL, the Brooklyn Health Officer, reports 192 deaths for the week ending August 12, being 71 deaths less than the week immediately preceding. There were 55 deaths by Cholera, 36 convulsions, 12 marasmus, 7 dysentery, 8 consumption, 4 inflammation of the brain:

headline.main: English Criticisms on Society in the United States.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some weeks since we copied and commented on a letter in the London Leader upon social life in the United States. We find in a subsequent number of that paper the following additional remarks on the same subject from the same pen.
docs.snippet: Some weeks since we copied and commented on a letter in the London Leader upon social life in the United States. We find in a subsequent number of that paper the following additional remarks on the same subject from the same pen.

docs.lead_paragraph: We learn by the following paragraph from the Roscommon Messenger, that JOHN B. DILLON, Esq., of this City, has received the permission of the English Government to return to Ireland. If the wishes of the many friends he has made during his brief residence among us could control his course, he would not he in haste to avail himself of this permission:

docs.lead_paragraph: The beautiful season here commenced about the middle of June; since which fair weather, and the must comfortable, the most delicious temperature conceivable, have invigorated the health and spirits, already overcoming many deleterious effects of an ungenial Spring.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Young Men's Protestant Society of Edinburg recently called Mr. MACAULAY to account for bring absent when Mr. SPOONER moved the omission of the item in the Civil Estimates for the payment of Roman Catholic chaplains in prisons.
